body: could you provide more verbose log from master, there's no conversion on line 339 on master at all.

I'm sorry, it's line 367!
The Matrix { xx, xy, yx, yy } line.
I wonder why it was triggered on AArch64, are you sure that is not ARM, btw? In anyway, this is the only error, right? I'll take a look later.

It's the only error in the whole build up until font, there are a few packages left though.
The pi4 is armv7l, or what do you mean?
ah, so it's a 32bit target in the end, not 64bit. otherwise it wouldn't make any sense.

rename.from: Build error on ARM64, font package.
rename.to: Build error on armv7l, font package.

body:
Cloned your fork.
Sorry to say it did'nt work.

```
  Compiling font v0.1.0 (/home/fuze/code/gits/alacritty/font)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> font/src/ft/mod.rs:339:26
    |
339 |                 Matrix { xx, xy, yx, yy }
    |                          ^^ expected `i32`, found `i64`
    |
help: you can convert an `i64` to `i32` and panic if the converted value wouldn't fit
    |
339 |                 Matrix { xx: xx.try_into().unwrap(), xy, yx, yy }
    |                          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^


```

issue.title: Fix compilation on 32bit targets
issue.body:
This works around libc's issue of setting `c_long` to a fixed value
rather than making it depend on the architecture, which caused the patch
92ea355eeea538bd868eaebdc03469630aba281c to fail.

Fixes #3915.
